titlestmt.titleproper: R. R. Dorsey notes taken from Chapman's lectures 1827-1828
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: R. R. Dorsey notes taken from Chapman's lectures

bioghist.p: Robert R. Dorsey was the author of a paper entitled "Efficacy of Rest in Injuries of the Knees".

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of volumes two and three of "Notes taken from Chapman's lectures on the theory and practice of physick" written by Robert R. Dorsey. Each volume is preceded by an index. Topics in volume two include Peritonitis, Diseases of the Alimentary Canal, Meningitis, Hemorrhoids, and so on. Topics in volume three include Lupus, Asthma, Palsy, Rheumatism, and Angina Pectoris.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: College of Physicians of Philadelphia: Fowler lecture notes (MSS 2/0027-01) and Hatfield lecture notes (MSS 2/0213-01); other volumes of Chapman lecture notes listed in CPP's Catalogue of Manuscripts and Archives under Chapman. University of Pennsylvania: Archives General Collection, 1740-1820, Curriculum collection: lecture notes taken by Holcome and Jones.
